text:
- All right, that's a wrap.
- Mark.

- When the camera is off--
- We're still on.

- ♪ It's the truth ♪
- ♪ The truth ♪

- ♪ The truth with Ruth ♪
- ♪ With Ruth and Ava, too ♪

- ♪ It's true ♪
- ♪ That's me and you ♪
♪ On the truth ♪

So, we have
a lot of questions,

but there's one that's
really "grading" on me.

- Get it?
- Because the next one's

- all about grades?
- Yep.

It's how to deal
with a bad grade.

Ugh, I just hate
getting bad grades.

I love school so much,
that when I get a bad grade,

- it really sucks. 
- This time I got a C-plus.

I once got a bad grade in math
and almost started crying.

- Oh, Ava!
- But the way I got over it

was that I kept studying
what I got wrong on the test,

figured out what I did wrong,
until it clicked.

And finally it did,
and I made up for my grades.
That's great, Ava.

I also think it's important
to talk to your teacher.

And see if there's any way
that you can help figure out

what to do differently
next time.
It's okay to ask for help.

Everybody gets bad grades
from time to time.

Yeah. It happens.
It's how we learn.

Can I give you a grade
on answering this question?

- Sure.
- I gave you an A-plus.
Aww, thanks, Ava.

Keep watching
"Sydney To The Max"...

Both:
On Disney Channel.
